Posted By: Deepfried-Owls (4/29/2011 9:47:06 PM)

posts.post_content:
I only put Elesh in my UWC deck because I pulled one when I was putting it together, but I've grown *very* fond of her as a 1-of. She's basically a fifth [Day of Judgment](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Day of Judgment) on legs for those games where you just can't quite seem to finish off your opponent, and actually isn't much slower than most of the deck's threats, which are all clustered around the 5 CMC slot ([Gideon Jura](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gideon Jura), [Baneslayer Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Baneslayer Angel), [Sunblast Angel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sunblast Angel) (actually 6, but same idea), [Elspeth Tirel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elspeth Tirel), etc.). So a turn 5 Gideon into turn 6 Colonnade animate into a turn 7 Elesh is an easy play - or turn 8 Elesh if you want to keep [Spell Pierce](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spell Pierce)/[Dispel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Dispel) mana open.  
  
Running more than one (*maybe* two) could be a bit prohibitive, and she's not going to go in against every deck. But for those times when your opponent is so sure you're out of board wipes and now's the time to gear up for... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
I only put Elesh in my UWC deck because I pulled one when I was putting it together, but I've grown very fond of her as a 1-of. She's basically a fifth Day of Judgment on legs for those games where you just can't quite seem to finish off your opponent, and actually isn't much slower than most of the deck's threats, which are all clustered around the 5 CMC slot (Gideon Jura, Baneslayer Angel, Sunblast Angel (actually 6, but same idea), Elspeth Tirel, etc.). So a turn 5 Gideon into turn 6 Colonnade animate into a turn 7 Elesh is an easy play - or turn 8 Elesh if you want to keep Spell Pierce/Dispel mana open.

Running more than one (maybe two) could be a bit prohibitive, and she's not going to go in against every deck. But for those times when your opponent is so sure you're out of board wipes and now's the time to gear up for... (see all)

posts.post_content:
@Arachnos, [Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite) beats [Sheoldred, Whispering One](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sheoldred, Whispering One) and [Vorniclex, Voice of Hunger](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Vorniclex, Voice of Hunger) in combat. Due to Norn's effect, Sheoldred becomes a 4/4 and Vorniclex becomes a 5/4 while Norn remains a 4/7 (Alive and **untapped**. She's one bad momma.   
  
Also, good luck playing Army of the Damned (with or without flashback) while this beauty is in standard.

Posted By: AlbinoSnowman (9/8/2011 11:52:38 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I think this gal is my favorite Praetor. No contest.  
  
She is the paragon of Phyrexia, that corrupts everything it touches. It's like the beauty and elegance of White were twisted, mutilated and deformed to give birth to her. This flowing silken gown, this elegant demeanor on a being that looks like a perversion of everything that is female, a Barbie doll straight out of a madman's fever dream. For the people out there who make fun of her faceplate, remember that she leads a mockery of a religion and as such it makes sense she would wear a ridiculously exaggerated hat. Pope hats are extravagant enough on their own.  
  
She embodies the ideal of White, to defend and protect, but she embodies it *wrong*. She shelters her own but simultaneously breaks down her opponent, a very Black shtick, that. Quite Phyrexian.  
  
And then there's the whole backstory about her and the sickening parody of a "religion" she leads, the Machine Orthodoxy.  
  
Very eerie and very Phyrexian. More so than any of th... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

I found [Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite) is very useful in my soldier deck. Posted By: Marsh-D-Teach (9/2/2011 10:10:37 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
That is not a hat.  
  
That is her face.  
  
**THAT IS HER FACE.**  
  
... that's scary. See also [Marrow Shards](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Marrow Shards).  
  
...I like how some of the Praetors were given a sort of arbitrary ability that happens to match their color nicely. Elesh : Vigilance. Jin-Gitaxias : Flash. Etc.  
  
It's also fun seeing everyone who cracks one of the Praetors go look up "praetor" and "cenobite" and "augur" and such in the dictionary. Praetor is an awesome creature type. And the titles given to each Praetor actually fit their color identity remarkably well. Congrats to WOTC for really nailing the New Phyrexia flavor :)
posts.html:
That is not a hat.

That is her face.

THAT IS HER FACE.

... that's scary. See also Marrow Shards.

...I like how some of the Praetors were given a sort of arbitrary ability that happens to match their color nicely. Elesh : Vigilance. Jin-Gitaxias : Flash. Etc.

It's also fun seeing everyone who cracks one of the Praetors go look up "praetor" and "cenobite" and "augur" and such in the dictionary. Praetor is an awesome creature type. And the titles given to each Praetor actually fit their color identity remarkably well. Congrats to WOTC for really nailing the New Phyrexia flavor :)
